entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Intl.Locale.prototype.variants
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Intl.Locale.prototype.variants
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+Intl.Locale.prototype.variants%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Intl.Locale.prototype.variants</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Mike+Taylor%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Mike Taylor</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251106" rel="nofollow">Thu, 06 Nov 2025 11:59:26 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre style="margin: 0em;"> LGTM3
On 11/6/25 1:20 p.m., Philip Jägenstedt wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;"> LGTM2</pre><pre></pre><tt>On Thu, Nov 6, 2025 at 7:14 PM 'Frank Tang (譚永鋒)' via blink-dev </tt><tt><<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="d6b4babfb8bdfbb2b3a096b5bea4b9bbbfa3bbf8b9a4b1">[email protected]</a>> wrote: </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Apple just said it is already shipped in Safari 26
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/commit/b8b32fe6a3c5cdaf94eab51e0dfef07620ac170e">https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/commit/b8b32fe6a3c5cdaf94eab51e0dfef07620ac170e</a> <a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=294755">https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=294755</a>
I will update the chromium entry
On Thu, Nov 6, 2025 at 9:41 AM Chris Harrelson <<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="4a29223823396464640a2922382527233f276425382d">[email protected]</a>> wrote:
LGTM1
On Wed, Nov 5, 2025 at 7:22 PM Chris Harrelson <<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="97f4ffe5fee4b9b9b9d7f4ffe5f8fafee2fab9f8e5f0">[email protected]</a>> wrote:
Hi Frank,
Since this is TC39 we don't need a position request as long as it's at stage 3. Sorry, my mistake.
On Wed, Nov 5, 2025 at 5:45 PM 'Frank Tang (譚永鋒)' via blink-dev <<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="98faf4f1f6f3b5fcfdeed8fbf0eaf7f5f1edf5b6f7eaff">[email protected]</a>> wrote:
API owner is asking about the position from WebKit so we need a Safari TR release note or WebKit bug tracking for this I think.
"What about webkit? Could you file a standards position request for them?"
On Wed, Nov 5, 2025 at 4:27 PM Shane Carr <<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="6f1c4141412f08000008030a410c0002">[email protected]</a>> wrote:
The Pull Request went through the TC39 process for normative pull requests. It was approved in the May 2025 TC39-TG1 plenary.
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tc39/notes/blob/main/meetings/2025-05/may-28.md#normative-add-intllocaleprototypevariants-ecma402960">https://github.com/tc39/notes/blob/main/meetings/2025-05/may-28.md#normative-add-intllocaleprototypevariants-ecma402960</a>
Here are notes from when TC39-TG2 approved the Pull Request before it went to plenary.
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tc39/ecma402/blob/main/meetings/notes-2025-05-08.md#normative-add-localeprototypegetvariants-960">https://github.com/tc39/ecma402/blob/main/meetings/notes-2025-05-08.md#normative-add-localeprototypegetvariants-960</a>
On Wed, Nov 5, 2025 at 2:03 PM Frank Tang (譚永鋒) <<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="96f0e2b8b8b8d6f1f9f9f1faf3b8f5f9fb">[email protected]</a>> wrote:
Engineers from Apple was present in the discussion of this spec change I will ask them tomorrow in TC39 TG2 meeting
On Wed, Nov 5, 2025 at 6:00 AM Chris Harrelson <<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="8cefe4fee5ffa2a2a2ccefe4fee3e1e5f9e1a2e3feeb">[email protected]</a>> wrote:
Hi,
What about webkit? Could you file a standards position request for them?
On Fri, Oct 31, 2025 at 6:07 PM Chromestatus <<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="d3b2b7fdfdfd93b0a1fea0a7b2a7a6a0fdb2a3a3a0a3bca7beb2babffdb0bcbe">[email protected]</a>> wrote:
*Contact emails* <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="2e485a0000006e49414149424b004d4143">[email protected]</a>
*Specification*
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://tc39.es/ecma402/#sec-Intl.Locale.prototype.variants">https://tc39.es/ecma402/#sec-Intl.Locale.prototype.variants</a>
*Summary* Add Intl.Locale.prototype.variants as stated in
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://tc39.es/ecma402/#sec-Intl.Locale.prototype.variants">https://tc39.es/ecma402/#sec-Intl.Locale.prototype.variants</a> and also accept "variants" in option bag in Intl.Locale consturctor as in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://tc39.es/ecma402/#sec-updatelanguageid">https://tc39.es/ecma402/#sec-updatelanguageid</a> The changes to ECMA402 is merged in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tc39/ecma402/pull/960">https://github.com/tc39/ecma402/pull/960</a> and the test code in test262 are merged in in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tc39/test262/pull/4474/">https://github.com/tc39/test262/pull/4474/</a>
*Blink component* Blink>JavaScript>Internationalization
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EJavaScript%3EInternationalization%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EJavaScript%3EInternationalization%22</a>>
*Web Feature ID* intl-locale <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://webstatus.dev/features/intl-locale">https://webstatus.dev/features/intl-locale</a>>
*Motivation* TC39 already approve for the change so it is now part of ECMA402 spec.
*Initial public proposal* /No information provided/
*TAG review* /No information provided/
*TAG review status* Issues addressed
*Risks*
*Interoperability and Compatibility* /No information provided/
/Gecko/: Shipped/Shipping (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1970161">https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1970161</a>)
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Firefox/Releases/141">https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Firefox/Releases/141</a>
/WebKit/: No signal
/Web developers/: Strongly positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/Locale/variants">https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/Locale/variants</a>)
/Other signals/:
*WebView application risks*
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
No
*Debuggability* /No information provided/
*Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?* Yes
*Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>>?* Yes Test262
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tc39/test262/tree/main/test/intl402/Locale">https://github.com/tc39/test262/tree/main/test/intl402/Locale</a> 'intl402/Locale/constructor-getter-order':
'intl402/Locale/constructor-options-throwing-getters':
'intl402/Locale/constructor-options-variants-invalid':
'intl402/Locale/constructor-options-variants-valid': 'intl402/Locale/getters-grandfathered': 'intl402/Locale/getters-missing': 'intl402/Locale/prototype/variants/name': 'intl402/Locale/prototype/variants/prop-desc':
*Flag name on about://flags* /No information provided/
*Finch feature name* /No information provided/
*Non-finch justification* /No information provided/
*Rollout plan* Will ship enabled for all users
*Requires code in //chrome?* False
*Availability expectation* Feature is available on Web Platform Baseline within 12 months of launch in Chrome.
*Adoption expectation* Feature is considered a best practice for some use case within 12 months of reaching Web Platform baseline.
*Non-OSS dependencies*
Does the feature depend on any code or APIs outside the Chromium open source repository and its open-source dependencies to function?
NO
*Estimated milestones* Shipping on desktop 144 Shipping on Android 144 Shipping on WebView 144
*Anticipated spec changes*
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (e.g. links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (e.g., changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way).
/No information provided/
*Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status*
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/4709921706868736?gate=5072143612248064">https://chromestatus.com/feature/4709921706868736?gate=5072143612248064</a>
*Links to previous Intent discussions* Intent to Prototype:
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/68e5bd35.050a0220.3258b8.05f2.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/68e5bd35.050a0220.3258b8.05f2.GAE%40google.com</a> Ready for Trial:
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/i6QEHcH_fiI/m/4xUyZbSvAAAJ">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/i6QEHcH_fiI/m/4xUyZbSvAAAJ</a>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Topics API
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Topics API
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Deprecate+and+Remove%5C%3A+Topics+API%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Topics API</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Yao+Xiao%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Yao Xiao</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251107" rel="nofollow">Fri, 07 Nov 2025 10:12:46 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>
Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Topics API</pre><pre>
Contact emails
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="92ebf3fdbcbcbcd2f1fae0fdfffbe7ffbcfde0f5">[email protected]</a>
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/patcg-individual-drafts/topics">https://github.com/patcg-individual-drafts/topics</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://patcg-individual-drafts.github.io/topics/">https://patcg-individual-drafts.github.io/topics/</a>
Summary
The Topics API is a privacy-preserving web API to enable ad-targeting based on a person’s general browsing interests, without exposing their exact browsing history.
Following Chrome's announcement that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained, we are now planning to deprecate and remove the Topics API (along with other Privacy Sandbox APIs).
The following API surfaces will be affected:
-
The JavaScript function `document.browsingTopics()` will be removed. -
The `browsingtopics` attribute on <iframe> and <img> elements will be ignored. -
The `browsingTopics` option in the fetch() API's RequestInit will be a no-op. -
Consequently, the `Sec-Browsing-Topics` request header will no longer be sent, and the `Observe-Browsing-Topics` response header will no longer be honored. -
The "browsing-topics" and "interest-cohort" permissions policy features will be removed.
Blink component
Blink>TopicsAPI <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/u/1/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3ETopicsAPI%22">https://issues.chromium.org/u/1/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3ETopicsAPI%22</a>>
Web Feature ID
None
Motivation
Chrome has announced that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained. Given this, we expect adoption to decrease over time (currently at 13% <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/5102">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/5102</a>> of page loads) as interest based advertising will remain possible in Chrome using third-party cookies. Further, other browser engines have not signaled interest in launching the API. See also the initial public proposal below.
Initial public proposal
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/</a> .
Possible breakage
Sites that rely on Topics API for targeting will experience utility impact.
If usage warrants, we will take steps to avoid any risk of page breakage, e.g. by temporarily retaining a stub implementation of `document.browsingTopics()` that mimics current behavior when a user has no topics to return. However, since Topics is not enabled by default for all users, sites should already be using feature detection, which makes the risks of breakage low.
Debuggability
N/A
Requires code in //chrome?
True
Estimated milestones
Deprecate in M144 and then remove in M150.
Currently, ~13% <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/5102">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/5102</a>> of page loads use Topics API. These are driven by a small number of third-party ad tech scripts present on a large number of sites. We will continue to monitor usage as well as provide comprehensive updates on privacysandbox.google.com <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://goo.gle/ps-status">http://goo.gle/ps-status</a>> with the status of the API and deprecation plans.
We will also proactively work toward reducing usage to a low level once the intent is approved, including disallowing any new enrollment sign-ups, and contacting all enrolled sites that use the Privacy Sandbox APIs to inform them about the deprecation timelines.
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5135370673061888">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5135370673061888</a>

To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/fc0175a0-5698-4312-9d31-a990bbe8c42cn%40chromium.org">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/fc0175a0-5698-4312-9d31-a990bbe8c42cn%40chromium.org</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Attribution Reporting API
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Attribution Reporting API
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Deprecate+and+Remove%5C%3A+Attribution+Reporting+API%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Attribution Reporting API</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Nan+Lin%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Nan Lin</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251107" rel="nofollow">Fri, 07 Nov 2025 10:35:53 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>
Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Attribution Reporting API</pre><pre>
Contact emails
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="acc0c5c2828282eccfc4dec3c1c5d9c182c3decb">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="fd97969c8fd3d3d3bd9e958f9290948890d3928f9a">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="f091809183959c8499dededeb09398829f9d99859dde9f8297">[email protected]</a>
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api">https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/attribution-reporting-api/">https://wicg.github.io/attribution-reporting-api/</a>
Summary
The Attribution Reporting API (ARA) is a privacy-preserving web API designed to measure ad conversions without third-party cookies or user tracking across sites.
Following Chrome's announcement <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/privacy-sandbox-next-steps/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/privacy-sandbox-next-steps/</a>> that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained, we are now planning to deprecate and remove <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/</a>>
the Attribution Reporting API (along with certain other Privacy Sandbox APIs, as outlined on the Privacy Sandbox feature status page <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>).
Blink component
Internals > AttributionReporting <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Internals%3EAttributionReporting">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Internals%3EAttributionReporting</a>>
Web Feature ID
None
Motivation
Chrome has announced <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/</a>>
that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained. Given this, we expect adoption of the Attribution Reporting API to decrease over time, as cross-site measurement will remain possible in Chrome using third-party cookies. Further, although Microsoft Edge integrates with the Attribution Reporting API, most other browser engines have not signaled interest in launching the API. Removing this (and certain other Privacy Sandbox APIs <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>) will help focus efforts on the proposed interoperable Attribution <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/attribution">https://github.com/w3c/attribution</a>> standard.
Developer-facing impact
Sites that are using the Attribution Reporting API for conversion measurement and do not migrate to alternative solutions may experience a disruption in conversion measurement on eventual removal of the API code from Chrome.
-
Conversion measurement disruption: All ad conversion events relying on the deprecated API will fail to register or report. Sites using this API as their primary or supplementary method for ad measurement will lose visibility into campaign performance metrics derived from this technology. -
Public API surface: The following outlines the consequences of deprecating and removing the Attribution Reporting API for each of the interfaces defined here <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/attribution-reporting-api/#idl-index">https://wicg.github.io/attribution-reporting-api/#idl-index</a>>. -
Potentially user-breaking -
XMLHttpRequest.setAttributionReporting(): Calling setAttributionReporting() on an XMLHttpRequest object will throw an exception because the method will no longer exist. This is a breaking change for any site that calls this method. Given that this feature is not implemented in other browsers, it is likely that sites are already using feature detection to check the method’s existence before calling it, which would prevent breakage. We will start to track the usage of this method. -
Non user-breaking -
HTMLAttributionSrcElementUtils and the attributionsrc attribute: The attributionsrc attribute on <a>, <area>, <img>, and <script> elements will be ignored. Any values assigned to this attribute will have no effect, and the browser will no longer initiate background requests to register attribution sources/triggers. Additionally we will no longer process trigger headers on legacy subresource requests that lack the opt-in (either on an element or fetch/XHR). This will not cause any visible breakage or errors on the page for the user, but it will silently prevent conversion measurement for sites that rely on this attribute. -
attributionsrc in window.open(): The attributionsrc feature in the features string of a window.open() call will be ignored. The window will still open as requested, but no attribution source will be registered. This will not cause any visible breakage or errors on the pages for the user, but it will silently prevent conversion measurement for sites that rely on this functionality. -
AttributionReportingRequestOptions and the attributionReporting member in RequestInit: The attributionReporting property within the options of a fetch() call will be ignored. The fetch request will still be made, but it will not trigger any attribution-related functionality. This change will not cause any JavaScript errors, but conversion measurement that relies on the fetch requests will no longer work. -
Attribution-Reporting-Eligible and Attribution-Reporting-Support headers: Since the browser will no longer process the attributionsrc attribute or the attributionReporting property in requests, it will no longer send these two headers on outgoing requests. -
attribution-reporting permission policy: The attribution-reporting permission policy
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/attribution-reporting-api/#permission-policy-integration">https://wicg.github.io/attribution-reporting-api/#permission-policy-integration</a>>
will be removed along with the API. Since the API it controls will no longer exist, the permission policy will have no effect and its removal is not considered a breaking change.
Planning and Estimated Milestones
Deprecate the browser API surface in M144 and remove in M150.
There will be one aspect of ARA that will end sooner. Server-side summary report computation will no longer operate by late December 2025. We have already communicated to the users of that service of these plans. Such users can use debug reports instead until the removal of the ARA surface as a whole. Since this impacts post-facto server-side operations, it will not incur any user-facing breakage.
Currently ~20% <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/webfeature/timeline/popularity/282">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/webfeature/timeline/popularity/282</a>> of page loads use the Attribution Reporting API. While ARA’s usage as a percentage of page loads is quite high, it is driven by a small number of third-party ad tech scripts present on a large number of sites. We will continue to monitor usage in addition to providing comprehensive updates on privacysandbox.google.com with the status of the API and deprecation plans <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>.
We will proactively work toward reducing ARA usage to low levels once this intent is approved, including disallowing any new enrollment sign-ups, and contacting enrolled sites to inform them about the deprecation timelines.
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/6320639375966208">https://chromestatus.com/feature/6320639375966208</a>
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="94f6f8fdfaffb9f0f1e2bfe1fae7e1f6e7f7e6bababad4f7fce6fbf9fde1f9bafbe6f3">[email protected]</a>. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/beb44d6a-aae5-4664-994a-38fb93bb4580n%40chromium.org">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/beb44d6a-aae5-4664-994a-38fb93bb4580n%40chromium.org</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Private Aggregation API
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Private Aggregation API
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Deprecate+and+Remove%5C%3A+Private+Aggregation+API%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Private Aggregation API</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Alex+Turner%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Alex Turner</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251107" rel="nofollow">Fri, 07 Nov 2025 11:02:43 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>
Contact emails</pre><pre>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="82e3eee7acacacc2e1eaf0edefebf7efacedf0e5">[email protected]</a>
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/patcg-individual-drafts/private-aggregation-api">https://github.com/patcg-individual-drafts/private-aggregation-api</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://patcg-individual-drafts.github.io/private-aggregation-api">https://patcg-individual-drafts.github.io/private-aggregation-api</a>
Summary
The Private Aggregation API is a generic mechanism for measuring aggregate, cross-site data in a privacy preserving manner. It was originally designed for a future without third-party cookies.
Following Chrome's announcement that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained, we are now planning to deprecate and remove the Private Aggregation API (along with certain other Privacy Sandbox APIs, as outlined on the Privacy Sandbox feature status page <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>). This API is only exposed via the Shared Storage and Protected Audience APIs, which are also planned to be deprecated and removed. So, no additional work will be required for Private Aggregation.
Blink component
Blink>PrivateAggregation <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EPrivateAggregation%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EPrivateAggregation%22</a>>
Web Feature ID
None
Motivation
Chrome has announced <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/</a>>
that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained. Given this, we expect adoption of the Private Aggregation API to decrease over time as cross-site measurement will remain possible in Chrome using third-party cookies. Further, other browser engines have not signaled interest in launching the API. Removing this (and certain other Privacy Sandbox APIs <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>) will help focus efforts on the proposed interoperable Attribution <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/attribution">https://github.com/w3c/attribution</a>> standard.
Possible breakage
Sites that rely on Private Aggregation reports for cross-site measurement and do not migrate to alternative solutions will experience a disruption on the removal of the API.
No specific JavaScript API changes are required to remove Private Aggregation as the API is only exposed within Protected Audience and Shared Storage contexts. So, Private Aggregation’s functionality is planned to be transitively removed by the removal of those two APIs.
If usage warrants, the Protected Audience and Shared Storage APIs may be temporarily retained with stub/no-op implementations of their calls to avoid any risk of page breakage. In that case, the isolated contexts where Private Aggregation is exposed would still no longer be created and there would be no need to retain a stub implementation of Private Aggregation.
User-facing risks
Please see Protected Audience and Shared Storage’s Intents to Deprecate and Remove.
Debuggability
N/A
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Estimated milestones
Deprecate in M144 and then remove in M150.
There will be one aspect of the API that will end sooner. Server-side <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/private-advertising/aggregation-service">https://privacysandbox.google.com/private-advertising/aggregation-service</a>> summary report computation will no longer operate by late December 2025. We have already communicated to the users of that service of these plans. Such users can use debug reports instead until the removal of the API surface as a whole. Since this impacts post-facto server-side operations, it will not incur any user-facing breakage.
Currently ~3% <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4333">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4333</a>> of page loads use the Private Aggregation API. While this usage is quite high for a deprecation and removal, it is driven by a small number of third-party ad tech scripts present on a large number of sites. We will continue to monitor usage in addition to providing comprehensive updates on privacysandbox.google.com with the status of the API and deprecation plans <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>.
We will proactively work toward reducing usage to low levels once this intent is approved, including disallowing any new enrollment sign-ups, and contacting enrolled sites to inform them about the deprecation timelines.
Please see Protected Audience and Shared Storage’s Intents to Deprecate and Remove for plans in case usage is still too high to fully remove those APIs at M150 due to user-facing breakage concerns.
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/4683382919397376?gate=6554931293192192">https://chromestatus.com/feature/4683382919397376?gate=6554931293192192</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/">https://chromestatus.com/</a>>.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="32505e5b5c591f56574419475c4147504151401c1c1c72515a405d5f5b475f1c5d4055">[email protected]</a>. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/8d2b9c6a-d1f1-4111-bdb4-31933998cd36n%40chromium.org">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/8d2b9c6a-d1f1-4111-bdb4-31933998cd36n%40chromium.org</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Protected Audience
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Protected Audience
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Deprecate+and+Remove%5C%3A+Protected+Audience%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Protected Audience</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Paul+Jensen%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Paul Jensen</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251107" rel="nofollow">Fri, 07 Nov 2025 11:04:43 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Protected Audience Contact emails
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="413120342d2b242f6f6f6f012229332e2c28342c6f2e3326">[email protected]</a></pre><pre>
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/FLEDGE.md</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/turtledove/">https://wicg.github.io/turtledove/</a>
SummaryThe Protected Audience API provides a method of interest-group advertising without third-party cookies or user tracking across sites.
Following Chrome's announcement <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/privacy-sandbox-next-steps/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/privacy-sandbox-next-steps/</a>> that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained, we are now planning to deprecate and remove <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/</a>> the Protected Audience API (along with certain other Privacy Sandbox APIs, as outlined on the Privacy Sandbox feature status page <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>).
Blink component
Blink>InterestGroups <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EInterestGroups%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EInterestGroups%22</a>>
Web Feature ID
None
Motivation
Chrome has announced that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained. Since that announcement there has been virtually no interest in the Protected Audience API. Use of the joinAdInterestGroup() API <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/3855">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/3855</a>> has decreased by almost 100x and use of the runAdAuction() API <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/3857">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/3857</a>> has decreased by more than 10x. Of the auctions occurring today, virtually none of them have winners (determined by looking at the “Success” bucket count of the Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.Result UMA), implying that they are not providing useful benefit to the pages initiating them.
Initial public proposal
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/</a> .
Developer-facing impact
Given that virtually none of the Protected Audience auctions occurring today have winners, we estimate the lost utility from this removal to be negligible.
User-facing risks
The user-facing risks are small. While removing the JavaScript API could cause pages to break, the impact should be limited to sites that don't employ standard defensive coding or feature detection, which should be rare since not all browsers implement the API.
If usage warrants, we will take steps to avoid any risk of page breakage, e.g. by temporarily retaining a stub implementation of Navigator APIs joinAdInterestGroup(), runAdAuction(), leaveAdInterestGroup(), clearOriginJoinedAdInterestGroups(), getInterestGroupAdAuctionData(), canLoadAdAuctionFencedFrame(), createAuctionNonce(), updateAdInterestGroups(), protectedAudience.queryFeatureSupport(), deprecatedReplaceInURN(), deprecatedURNtoURL(), and adAuctionComponents() that mimic current behavior when a user has disabled Protected Audience.
Estimated milestones
Planning to deprecate in M144 and remove in M150.
Currently 0.22% <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4188">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4188</a>> of page loads use the Protected Audience API. These are driven by a small number of third-party ad tech scripts present on a large number of sites. We will continue to monitor usage as well as provide comprehensive updates on privacysandbox.google.com with the status of the API and deprecation plans <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>.
We will also proactively work toward reducing usage to low levels once this intent is approved, including disallowing any new enrollment sign-ups, and contacting enrolled sites to inform them about the deprecation timelines.
Protected Audience features that were never launched beyond 20% Stable (TextEncoder support <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/961#issuecomment-2793763963">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/961#issuecomment-2793763963</a>>, Creative scanning via BYOS/V1 trusted scoring signals <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/EXfp34Qb1oc/m/oaiY6MENBwAJ">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/EXfp34Qb1oc/m/oaiY6MENBwAJ</a>>, Selectable Reporting IDs <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/1cWqBPHngd0/m/gSYeR_dPAAAJ">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/1cWqBPHngd0/m/gSYeR_dPAAAJ</a>>) will be ramped down by the end of 2025.
Protected Audience services, Bidding and Auction services <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/CyXJz3xOEcc/m/1snkv2KhAwAJ">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/CyXJz3xOEcc/m/1snkv2KhAwAJ</a>> and Trusted Key Value service <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/fH8u7ZTNZg8/m/oo0WVw7SAQAJ">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/fH8u7ZTNZg8/m/oo0WVw7SAQAJ</a>>, will not onboard new clients once deprecation is approved. We will work with onboarded clients and plan to turn down the services by the end of year as usage is negligible today. This will have no user-facing or web-compat impact.
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/6552486106234880">https://chromestatus.com/feature/6552486106234880</a>
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="76141a1f181d5b1213005d031805031405150458585836151e04191b1f031b58190411">[email protected]</a>. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABQTWrnevtY14OMos%2BuDgzXtFwQJ5vzY3hEMmyRFQBKDHBz-9A%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABQTWrnevtY14OMos%2BuDgzXtFwQJ5vzY3hEMmyRFQBKDHBz-9A%40mail.gmail.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent To Deprecate and Remove: Shared Storage API
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent To Deprecate and Remove: Shared Storage API
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+To+Deprecate+and+Remove%5C%3A+Shared+Storage+API%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent To Deprecate and Remove: Shared Storage API</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Cammie+Smith+Barnes%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Cammie Smith Barnes</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251107" rel="nofollow">Fri, 07 Nov 2025 11:32:42 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Intent to deprecate and remove Shared Storage </pre><pre>
Contact emails
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="dbb8bab6f5f5f59bb8b3a9b4b6b2aeb6f5b4a9bc">[email protected]</a>
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/blob/main/README.md">https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/blob/main/README.md</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/shared-storage/">https://wicg.github.io/shared-storage/</a>
Summary
The Shared Storage API is a privacy-preserving web API to enable storage that is not partitioned by first-party site.
Following Chrome's announcement <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/privacy-sandbox-next-steps/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/privacy-sandbox-next-steps/</a>> that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained, we are now planning to deprecate and remove the Shared Storage API (along with certain other Privacy Sandbox APIs, as outlined on the Privacy Sandbox feature status page <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>).
Interest in the Shared Storage API has decreased since the announcement. Use of sharedStorage.worklet.addModule() <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4264">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4264</a>> has decreased ~20% from its peak of 7.35% of page loads down to 5.85% of page loads. Use of sharedStorage.createWorklet() <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4836">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4836</a>> has decreased ~82% from 4.87% to 0.864% of page loads. Use of sharedStorage.run() <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4270">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4270</a>> has decreased ~30% from 5.28% to 3.71% of page loads. Use of sharedStorage.selectURL() <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4269">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4269</a>> has decreased ~28% from 6.24% to 4.51% of page loads. Use of sharedStorage overall <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4263">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4263</a>> has decreased ~9% from 11.91% of page loads to 10.86% of page loads.
Blink component
Blink>Storage>SharedStorage <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EStorage%3ESharedStorage%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EStorage%3ESharedStorage%22</a>>
Web Feature ID
None
Motivation
Chrome has announced <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/</a>> that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained. Given this, we expect adoption to decrease over time (currently at ~11% <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4263">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4263</a>> of page loads) as the main use cases for Shared Storage will remain possible in Chrome using third-party cookies. Further, other browser engines have not signaled interest in launching the API. See also the initial public proposal below.
Developer-facing impact
Sites that are using the Shared Storage API that do not migrate to alternative solutions may experience a disruption in functionality, and in particular all writes, reads, and worklet operations will fail. If continued usage numbers warrant, we will take steps to minimize any risk of actual page breakage, e.g. by temporarily retaining stub implementations of the window-exposed methods that are still being called most frequently.
The following API surfaces will be removed:
-
All of the Shared Storage JavaScript functions exposed to the Window
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/blob/main/README.md#outside-of-worklets-eg-places-where-writing-can-happen">https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/blob/main/README.md#outside-of-worklets-eg-places-where-writing-can-happen</a>> will be removed or replaced with stub implementations: -
`window.sharedStorage.worklet.addModule()` -
`window.sharedStorage.createWorklet()` -
`window.sharedStorage.worklet.run()`/`sharedStorage.run()` -
`window.sharedStorage.worklet.selectURL()`/`sharedStorage.selectURL()` -
`window.sharedStorage.set()` -
`window.sharedStorage.append()` -
`window.sharedStorage.delete()` -
`window.sharedStorage.clear()` -
`window.sharedStorage.batchUpdate()` -
All of the Shared Storage JavaScript functions exposed only to the SharedStorageWorklet
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/blob/main/README.md#in-the-worklet-during-an-operation">https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/blob/main/README.md#in-the-worklet-during-an-operation</a>> will be removed. Since the worklet operation methods (`sharedStorage.run()` and `sharedStorage.selectURL()` listed above) will be removed or replaced with no-op stub implementations, there will be no calls to any SharedStorageWorklet-exposed Shared Storage JavaScript functions, and so removing them will cause no breakage. -
The SharedStorageWorklet interface will be removed or replaced by a stub worklet interface (potentially for `addModule`, `run`, `selectURL` stub implementations). -
Consequently the `sharedStorage.worklet` attribute will either be removed or updated to the stub worklet interface type pending removal. -
The `sharedStorage.context` attribute will be removed, along with the related `setSharedStorageContext()` method on fenced frame configs. We will measure the usage of `setSharedStorageContext()` to determine whether it should be replaced with a no-op stub implementation instead. -
The `sharedstoragewritable` attribute on <iframe> and <img> elements will be ignored. -
The `sharedStorageWritable` option in the fetch() API's RequestInit will be a no-op. -
Consequently, the `Sec-Shared-Storage-Writable` and `Sec-Shared-Storage-Data-Origin` request headers will no longer be sent, and the `Shared-Storage-Write` and `Shared-Storage-Cross-Origin-Worklet-Allowed` response headers will no longer be honored. -
The “shared-storage” and “shared-storage-select-url” permissions policy-controlled features will be removed along with the APIs. Since the APIs they control will no longer exist, the permission policies will have no effect and their removal is not considered a breaking change. -
The `sharedStorage` attribute on the Window will be removed once all stub implementations are no longer needed and are removed.
Estimated milestones
Planning to deprecate in M144 and remove in M150.
Currently, ~11% <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4263">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4263</a>> of page loads use Shared Storage API. While this usage is quite high for a deprecation and removal, it is driven by a small number of third-party ad tech scripts present on a large number of sites. We will continue to monitor usage in addition to providing comprehensive updates on privacysandbox.google.com with the status of the API and deprecation plans <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status">https://privacysandbox.google.com/overview/status</a>>.
We will proactively work toward reducing usage to low levels once this intent is approved, including disallowing any new enrollment sign-ups, and contacting enrolled sites to inform them about the deprecation timelines.
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5076349064708096">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5076349064708096</a>
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="2446484d4a4f094041520f514a5751465747560a0a0a64474c564b494d51490a4b5643">[email protected]</a>. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAJ8xcq6ty%3DiW_L9%3DpbzJbZKAT7rVdu_%2B9-QJ2P2ojCRtSRk4xw%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAJ8xcq6ty%3DiW_L9%3DpbzJbZKAT7rVdu_%2B9-QJ2P2ojCRtSRk4xw%40mail.gmail.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: document.requestStorageAccessFor
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: document.requestStorageAccessFor
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Deprecate+and+Remove%5C%3A+document.requestStorageAccessFor%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: document.requestStorageAccessFor</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22%27Johann+Hofmann%27+via+blink%5C-dev%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">'Johann Hofmann' via blink-dev</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251107" rel="nofollow">Fri, 07 Nov 2025 11:45:23 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="80eaefe8e1eeeeaeaeaec0e7efefe7ece5aee3efed">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="dbb0baaea8afaeb9f5f5f59bbcb4b4bcb7bef5b8b4b6">[email protected]</a></pre><pre>
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/requestStorageAccessFor">https://github.com/privacycg/requestStorageAccessFor</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacycg.github.io/requestStorageAccessFor/">https://privacycg.github.io/requestStorageAccessFor/</a>
Summary
The requestStorageAccessFor (rSAFor) API is an extension to the Storage Access API that allows a top-level site to request access to unpartitioned ("first-party") cookies on behalf of embedded sites. Browsers will have discretion to grant or deny access, with mechanisms like Related Website Sets (RWS) membership as a potential signal. This allows for use of the Storage Access API by top-level sites. Following Chrome's announcement that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained, we are now planning to deprecate and remove rSAFor, as it is only usable in Chrome to request storage access between RWS sites. Related Website Sets will also be deprecated via a separate intent.
Blink component
Blink>StorageAccessAPI <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3EStorageAccessAPI">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3EStorageAccessAPI</a>>
Web Feature ID
None
Motivation
Chrome has announced <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/</a>> that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained. rSAFor currently has usage on about 0.95% of page loads <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4332">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4332</a>>, but any website relying on successful invocation of rSAFor (i.e. the API returns a promise that resolves) must also have registered a set on the RWS GitHub repository <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/GoogleChrome/related-website-sets/blob/main/related_website_sets.JSON">https://github.com/GoogleChrome/related-website-sets/blob/main/related_website_sets.JSON</a>>. Any invocations of rSAFor outside of an RWS currently returns a promise that is rejected.
Our metrics suggest that almost all of the usage of rSAFor is from websites that have registered sets. We will continue to monitor usage and aim to drive it down prior to removal by proactively informing set owners of the deprecation timelines and request them to turn down usage. Additionally, other browser engines have not signaled interest in implementing the API, obviating any interoperability concerns.
Debuggability
N/A
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Estimated milestones
Deprecate in M144, and target M150 for removal.
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5122534152863744">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5122534152863744</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/">https://chromestatus.com/</a>>.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="2e4c42474045034a4b58055b405d5b4c5d4d5c0000006e4d465c4143475b4300415c49">[email protected]</a>. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAD_OO4jZZCadQdpoTcZBfDR4L19fe-NUTuDhTWJc%2BYThZp6erQ%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAD_OO4jZZCadQdpoTcZBfDR4L19fe-NUTuDhTWJc%2BYThZp6erQ%40mail.gmail.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Related Website Sets (RWS)
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Related Website Sets (RWS)
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Deprecate+and+Remove%5C%3A+Related+Website+Sets+%5C%28RWS%5C%29%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Deprecate and Remove: Related Website Sets (RWS)</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22%27Johann+Hofmann%27+via+blink%5C-dev%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">'Johann Hofmann' via blink-dev</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251107" rel="nofollow">Fri, 07 Nov 2025 11:48:07 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="03696c6b626d6d2d2d2d43646c6c646f662d606c6e">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="0b606a7e787f7e692525254b6c64646c676e25686466">[email protected]</a></pre><pre>
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/first-party-sets">https://github.com/WICG/first-party-sets</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/first-party-sets/">https://wicg.github.io/first-party-sets/</a>
Summary
Related Website Sets (RWS), formerly known as First Party Sets, provides a framework for developers to declare relationships among sites, to enable limited cross-site cookie access for specific, user-facing purposes. This is facilitated through the use of the Storage Access API <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access</a>> (SAA) and requestStorageAccessFor <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/requestStorageAccessForOrigin/">https://github.com/privacycg/requestStorageAccessForOrigin/</a>> (rSAFor). RWS was designed for use in a browser without third-party cookies. Following Chrome's announcement that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained, we are now planning to deprecate and remove Related Website Sets (RWS).
Once RWS is deprecated; existing usage of SAA across contexts within a set will fall back to the API’s behavior outside of RWS as specified here <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacycg.github.io/storage-access/">https://privacycg.github.io/storage-access/</a>>. The difference in SAA behavior outside of RWS is well illustrated in our developer blogpost here <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.google.com/cookies/storage-access-api#how_is_the_storage_access_api_different_when_used_with_rws">https://privacysandbox.google.com/cookies/storage-access-api#how_is_the_storage_access_api_different_when_used_with_rws</a>> .
The companion rSAFor API will also be deprecated via a separate intent.
We also intend to deprecate RWS-related Chrome Enterprise policies <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#RelatedWebsiteSets">https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/#RelatedWebsiteSets</a>>, as well as the chrome.privacy.relatedWebsiteSetsEnabled extension API; and will follow the relevant processes.
Blink component
Privacy <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues?q=is:open">https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues?q=is:open</a>>
Web Feature ID
None
Motivation
Chrome has announced <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/">https://privacysandbox.com/news/update-on-plans-for-privacy-sandbox-technologies/</a>> that the current approach to third-party cookies will be maintained. RWS usage is indicated by the number of registered sets (currently at 71 sets <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/GoogleChrome/related-website-sets/blob/main/related_website_sets.JSON">https://github.com/GoogleChrome/related-website-sets/blob/main/related_website_sets.JSON</a>>), and the usage of the requestStorageAccessFor API (currently at about 0.95% of pageloads <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4332">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4332</a>>), and after this announcement we intend to archive the registration repository, and expect adoption of rSAFor to decrease over time.
We will continue to monitor usage and aim to drive it down prior to removal by proactively informing set owners of the deprecation timelines and request them to turn down usage. Further, other browser engines have not signaled interest in launching the API, obviating any interoperability concerns.
Debuggability
N/A
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Estimated milestones
Deprecate in M144, and target M150 for removal.
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5640066519007232">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5640066519007232</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/">https://chromestatus.com/</a>>.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="37555b5e595c1a5352411c425944425544544519191977545f45585a5e425a19584550">[email protected]</a>. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAD_OO4jqw7%2BOvbdxDrFgCDhOs05KJwHP2O1StgaX524pLEg6Yw%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAD_OO4jqw7%2BOvbdxDrFgCDhOs05KJwHP2O1StgaX524pLEg6Yw%40mail.gmail.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Web-Facing Change PSA: Respect overscroll-behavior for keyboard scrolls
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Web-Facing Change PSA: Respect overscroll-behavior for keyboard scrolls
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Web%5C-Facing+Change+PSA%5C%3A+Respect+overscroll%5C-behavior+for+keyboard+scrolls%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Web-Facing Change PSA: Respect overscroll-behavior for keyboard scrolls</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251111" rel="nofollow">Tue, 11 Nov 2025 09:42:11 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="67010b0649494927040f15080a0e120a49081500">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="c0baa8afb5b0a5aea7eef1eeeeee80a2b9b4a5a4a1aea3a5eea3afad">[email protected]</a> </pre><pre>
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overscroll-1">https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overscroll-1</a>
Summary When you set `overscroll-behavior` to a value other than `auto`, the browser should not perform scroll chaining. We respect this for mouse or touch scrolling, however keyboard scrolls were ignoring it. This change makes keyboard scrolling respect overscroll-behavior as well.
Blink component Blink>Scroll
Web Feature ID overscroll-behavior
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility Both Firefox and Safari already respect overscroll-behavior when performing keyboard scrolls so the compat risk should be minimal as this will make Chrome behave interoperably with them.
Gecko: Shipped/Shipping
WebKit: Shipped/Shipping
Web developers: No signals
Other signals:
Activation Developers are already using overscroll-behavior. Likely keyboard scrolling has not been common enough to be a big concern but developers won't need to change their code to take advantage of this.
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications? No information provided
Debuggability The overscroll-behavior property can easily be inspected in dev tools.
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)? Yes
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests? Yes <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-overscroll-behavior?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=overscroll-behavior-keyboard-scroll">https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-overscroll-behavior?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=overscroll-behavior-keyboard-scroll</a>
Tracking bug <a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/41378182">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/41378182</a>
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop 144
Shipping on Android 144
Shipping on WebView 144
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5099117340655616">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5099117340655616</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="6a0806030401470e0f1c411f04191f081909184444442a0902180507031f074405180d">[email protected]</a>. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/69137555.050a0220.1c094.057e.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/69137555.050a0220.1c094.057e.GAE%40google.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Extend Experiment: Playout Statistics API for WebAudio
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Extend Experiment: Playout Statistics API for WebAudio
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Extend+Experiment%5C%3A+Playout+Statistics+API+for+WebAudio%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Extend Experiment: Playout Statistics API for WebAudio</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251112" rel="nofollow">Wed, 12 Nov 2025 01:40:29 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="32545a57405c43441c1c1c72555d5d555e571c515d5f">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="f19edfdfdfb1969e9e969d94df929e9c">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="7b1314151c185555553b1c14141c171e55181416">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="e382849382cdcdcda3848c8c848f86cd808c8e">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="8ee9fbe7a0a0a0cee9e1e1e9e2eba0ede1e3">[email protected]</a></pre><pre>
Explainer <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/web_audio_playout">https://github.com/WICG/web_audio_playout</a>
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/web_audio_playout">https://wicg.github.io/web_audio_playout</a>
Summary The AudioContext.playoutStats API allows an application to measure the quality and latency of audio playout using WebAudio.
Blink component Blink>WebAudio
Web Feature ID No information provided
TAG review Early TAG review request: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/939">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/939</a>
TAG review status Issues addressed
Origin Trial Name Playout Statistics API for WebAudio
Chromium Trial Name AudioContextPlayoutStats
Origin Trial documentation link <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/web_audio_playout">https://github.com/WICG/web_audio_playout</a>
WebFeature UseCounter name kAudioContextPlayoutStats
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility No information provided
Gecko: No signal
WebKit: No signal
Web developers: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/proposals/issues/142#issuecomment-1981012486">https://github.com/WICG/proposals/issues/142#issuecomment-1981012486</a>)
Other signals:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications? No information provided
Goals for experimentation No information provided
Reason this experiment is being extended Since the previous extension, we have presented the API to the Audio WG, where it was agreed that we should land the API in the WebAudio spec. The PR[1] has had a number of rounds of review, and is now close to landing (as discussed at TPAC 2025) [2]. Since the requested changes to the API include naming changes, applications using the Origin Trial version of the API will not be compatible with the new version of the API out of the box. To give us time to land the spec and to give applications time to migrate to the new version, we are requesting an extension of 3 milestones until 145. [1] <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/pull/2645">https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/pull/2645</a> [2] <a rel="nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/15bLL2UujSW4OdSa0Kv66wziXBTq34jWOntNDbs2pPek/edit?tab=t.dpp97ymwtdhx#heading=h.m9ld885gturz">https://docs.google.com/document/d/15bLL2UujSW4OdSa0Kv66wziXBTq34jWOntNDbs2pPek/edit?tab=t.dpp97ymwtdhx#heading=h.m9ld885gturz</a>
Reason this experiment is being extended Since the last extension, the Privacy WG have reviewed the API, and noted some security concerns[1]. We have discussed them and agreed on a set of mitigations, given which the Privacy WG have indicated that they will approve the API[2]. If you don't have access to the slack thread, you can read the relevant messages here (shared with Blink API-owners)[3] We have updated the spec with a formal algorithm which includes the mitigations as well as a Privacy & Security considerations section discussing the concerns. [4] We are requesting this Origin Trial extension to give us time to get the Privacy WG's final approval on the new version of the spec, and present it to the Audio WG (who are positive towards the API when it was presented at TPAC but want approval from the Privacy WG before adopting it). [1] <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/web_audio_playout/issues/4">https://github.com/WICG/web_audio_playout/issues/4</a> [2] <a rel="nofollow" href="https://w3ccommunity.slack.com/archives/C06BB1JR528/p1747683821732619?thread_ts=1744909746.069129&cid=C06BB1JR528">https://w3ccommunity.slack.com/archives/C06BB1JR528/p1747683821732619?thread_ts=1744909746.069129&cid=C06BB1JR528</a> [3] <a rel="nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Mg-O-YX4xiFJ2qtvjRDL_F5SbKf74TJFYYQnTCE5QrU/edit?tab=t.0">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Mg-O-YX4xiFJ2qtvjRDL_F5SbKf74TJFYYQnTCE5QrU/edit?tab=t.0</a> [4] <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/web_audio_playout/">https://wicg.github.io/web_audio_playout/</a>
Reason this experiment is being extended We need additional time to work with Privacy WG to address their concerns. Since the origin trial started, we have made the following progress: * The API was presented at TPAC, and got a positive reaction from Audio WG. However, they wanted to hear the Privacy WG's input, and that we should ask the internal privacy/security reviewers why the API is ok while the similar RenderCapacity API was not ok. ( <a rel="nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QiBmVZb51ATyai_TTbkMnq25zaQOzVNxNIsPJZ8sdUE/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.el9c5z4prh05">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QiBmVZb51ATyai_TTbkMnq25zaQOzVNxNIsPJZ8sdUE/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.el9c5z4prh05</a> ) * We have presented the API to the Privacy WG and they have discussed it (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/privacywg/blob/main/minutes/privacywg-20250417.md#webaudio">https://github.com/w3c/privacywg/blob/main/minutes/privacywg-20250417.md#webaudio</a>) . We are now having an active discussion with them about how we can address their concerns. * Google-internal privacy/security reviewers have reaffirmed that the API is ok, and safer than the RenderCapacity API. * We have added wpt tests for the API.
Ongoing technical constraints None.
Debuggability Can be tested by creating an AudioContext and evaluating context.playoutStats in the console.
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)? Yes
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests? Yes <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/webaudio/the-audio-api/the-audiocontext-interface/audiocontext-playoutstats.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned">https://wpt.fyi/results/webaudio/the-audio-api/the-audiocontext-interface/audiocontext-playoutstats.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned</a> These will be updated if the API shape changes.
Flag name on about://flags No information provided
Finch feature name AudioContextPlayoutStats
Requires code in //chrome? False
Estimated milestones
Origin trial desktop first 131
Origin trial desktop last 136
Origin trial extension 1 end milestone 145
Origin trial extension 2 end milestone 142
Origin trial extension 3 end milestone 139
DevTrial on desktop 129
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5172818344148992?gate=6552352408600576">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5172818344148992?gate=6552352408600576</a>
Links to previous Intent discussions Intent to Prototype: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACazmWW4MYVa_iGjN%3DK4O9B1DE3rt4_2Vkqnq6sKswHFjn6BzQ%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACazmWW4MYVa_iGjN%3DK4O9B1DE3rt4_2Vkqnq6sKswHFjn6BzQ%40mail.gmail.com</a> Intent to Experiment: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACazmWWV6S6Ba%3Dd%3DgvjhERm1OnPyBMRJx5fbkP%3Df9zb3k%3DrNDA%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACazmWWV6S6Ba%3Dd%3DgvjhERm1OnPyBMRJx5fbkP%3Df9zb3k%3DrNDA%40mail.gmail.com</a> Intent to Extend Experiment 2: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/686d135c.2b0a0220.3a1521.0081.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/686d135c.2b0a0220.3a1521.0081.GAE%40google.com</a> Intent to Extend Experiment 3: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACazmWVkWb8DJM_aCRGOFpskBs-7h%3DO_yggKc3YBUkiieEO-UA%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACazmWVkWb8DJM_aCRGOFpskBs-7h%3DO_yggKc3YBUkiieEO-UA%40mail.gmail.com</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="e3818f8a8d88ce878695c8968d909681908091cdcdcda3808b918c8e8a968ecd8c9184">[email protected]</a>. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/691455eb.2b0a0220.e30ce.7e1f.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/691455eb.2b0a0220.e30ce.7e1f.GAE%40google.com</a>. </pre>
</div>
