entry.title: [blink-dev] Web-Facing Change PSA: Tune border-radius correction to better match circles/ellipses
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Web-Facing Change PSA: Tune border-radius correction to better match circles/ellipses
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Web%5C-Facing+Change+PSA%5C%3A+Tune+border%5C-radius+correction+to+better+match+circles%5C%2Fellipses%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Web-Facing Change PSA: Tune border-radius correction to better match circles/ellipses</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251021" rel="nofollow">Tue, 21 Oct 2025 12:13:49 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="69071b061a0c071d474747290a011b0604001c0447061b0e">[email protected]</a> </pre><pre>
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://drafts.csswg.org/css-backgrounds-3/#corner-shaping">https://drafts.csswg.org/css-backgrounds-3/#corner-shaping</a>
Summary Render box-shadow spread and overflow-clip-margin for elements with border-radius, in a way that works better for high border-radius. Specifically shadows and margins of circles (or whenever the border radius is close to 50%), would look closer to the original shape.
Blink component Blink>CSS
Web Feature ID border-radius
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility No information provided
Gecko: No signal
WebKit: No signal
Web developers: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/7103">https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/7103</a>)
Other signals:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications? No information provided
Debuggability No information provided
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)? Yes
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests? Yes
Tracking bug <a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/448651073">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/448651073</a>
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop 143

Shipping on WebView 143

To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/68f7db65.050a0220.39dfc1.0b97.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/68f7db65.050a0220.39dfc1.0b97.GAE%40google.com</a>. </pre>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Extend Experiment: Shared Array Buffers, Atomics and Futex APIs
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Extend Experiment: Shared Array Buffers, Atomics and Futex APIs
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Extend+Experiment%5C%3A+Shared+Array+Buffers%2C+Atomics+and+Futex+APIs%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Extend Experiment: Shared Array Buffers, Atomics and Futex APIs</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20251021" rel="nofollow">Tue, 21 Oct 2025 09:01:51 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="4f396161610f2c273d2022263a2261203d28">[email protected]</a>, <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="d9bab5f7f7f799bab1abb6b4b0acb4f7b6abbe">[email protected]</a> </pre><pre>
Explainer No information provided
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://tc39.github.io/ecma262/#sec-sharedarraybuffer-objects">https://tc39.github.io/ecma262/#sec-sharedarraybuffer-objects</a>
Design docs No information provided <a rel="nofollow" href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/SharedArrayBuffer">https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/SharedArrayBuffer</a>
Summary Adds the JavaScript type SharedArrayBuffer gated behind COOP/COEP. The concept of a SharedArrayBuffer is that a message to a worker, is posted but instead of copying the content of the array just a reference to it is shared. The Atomic API provides atomic loads and stores and Read/Modify/Write accesses to SharedArrayBuffers. The Atomic.wait provides the ability for a worker to wait for another worker to signal it, without having to spinlock.
Blink component Blink>JavaScript
Web Feature ID No information provided
Search tags SharedArrayBuffer, SAB
TAG review <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/471">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/471</a>
TAG review status Pending
Origin Trial Name SharedArrayBuffers in non-isolated pages on Desktop platforms
Chromium Trial Name UnrestrictedSharedArrayBuffer
Link to origin trial feedback summary <a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?components=Internals%3ESandbox%3ESiteIsolation">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?components=Internals%3ESandbox%3ESiteIsolation</a>
Origin Trial documentation link <a rel="nofollow" href="https://developer.chrome.com/blog/enabling-shared-array-buffer/">https://developer.chrome.com/blog/enabling-shared-array-buffer/</a>
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility No information provided
Gecko: Shipped/Shipping (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1312446">https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1312446</a>)
WebKit: Shipped/Shipping (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://developer.apple.com/library/content/releasenotes/General/WhatsNewInSafari/Articles/Safari_10_1.html">https://developer.apple.com/library/content/releasenotes/General/WhatsNewInSafari/Articles/Safari_10_1.html</a>)
Web developers: Positive
Other signals:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications? No information provided
Goals for experimentation No information provided
Reason this experiment is being extended This is a deprecation trial, and we're giving more time to websites to stop using the deprecated behavior.
Reason this experiment is being extended The release of DocumentIsolationPolicy in M137 is helping developers adopt crossOriginIsolation as a way out of this reverse Origin Trial. However, it will still take time for developers to adopt. We would like to extend the OT as the final extension and give developers 6 milestones to get out of this reverse Origin Trial. Once this is approved and developers have requested their token, we will close this trial so that no further origins adopt the deprecated behavior.
Reason this experiment is being extended We still have one of the historic users of ungated SharedArrayBuffers which has not managed to transition to cross-origin isolation (Google Earth). They are in the process of deploying COEP and asked us for an extension of the reverse origin trial until M146, when they believe they will be done with COEP deployment. Once the extension is approved, we'll close the Origin Trial to ensure no new users can register.
Ongoing technical constraints No information provided
Debuggability DevTools warning in case SAB is used in none COI context is in place
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)? No
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests? Yes <a rel="nofollow" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/web_tests/external/wpt/html/infrastructure/safe-passing-of-structured-data/shared-array-buffers/no-coop-coep.https.any.js">https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/web_tests/external/wpt/html/infrastructure/safe-passing-of-structured-data/shared-array-buffers/no-coop-coep.https.any.js</a> <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tc39/test262/tree/master/test/built-ins/SharedArrayBuffer">https://github.com/tc39/test262/tree/master/test/built-ins/SharedArrayBuffer</a> <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tc39/test262/tree/master/test/built-ins/Atomics">https://github.com/tc39/test262/tree/master/test/built-ins/Atomics</a>
Flag name on about://flags No information provided
Finch feature name No information provided
Non-finch justification No information provided
Requires code in //chrome? False
Tracking bug <a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=709179">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=709179</a>
Launch bug <a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138860">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138860</a>
Estimated milestones
Origin trial desktop first 92
Origin trial desktop last 131
Origin trial extension 1 end milestone 109
Origin trial extension 2 end milestone 131
Origin trial extension 3 end milestone 124
Origin trial extension 4 end milestone 136
Origin trial extension 5 end milestone 142
Origin trial extension 6 end milestone 146
DevTrial on desktop 60
DevTrial on Android 88
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/4570991992766464?gate=5932856039833600">https://chromestatus.com/feature/4570991992766464?gate=5932856039833600</a>
Links to previous Intent discussions Intent to Experiment: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/1NKvbIj3dq4">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/1NKvbIj3dq4</a> Intent to Extend Experiment 1: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAH0ixBN2JhcYtpT4UYKcAfHt1e0Wz_Uxz0CkXcAntguhbmyNCA%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAH0ixBN2JhcYtpT4UYKcAfHt1e0Wz_Uxz0CkXcAntguhbmyNCA%40mail.gmail.com</a> Intent to Extend Experiment 2: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/u/1/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/4tDmckQLZLQ">https://groups.google.com/u/1/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/4tDmckQLZLQ</a> Intent to Extend Experiment 3: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/UospzV3lZMk/m/X9K0k8kuAQAJ">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/UospzV3lZMk/m/X9K0k8kuAQAJ</a> Intent to Extend Experiment 4: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/A4CR6MIVzds/m/rpsWnzq6AAAJ?e=48417069">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/A4CR6MIVzds/m/rpsWnzq6AAAJ?e=48417069</a> Intent to Extend Experiment 5: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/681b67ca.170a0220.4750a.028e.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/681b67ca.170a0220.4750a.028e.GAE%40google.com</a> Intent to Ship: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/1NKvbIj3dq4">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/1NKvbIj3dq4</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="c1a3ada8afaaeca5a4b7eab4afb2b4a3b2a2b3efefef81a2a9b3aeaca8b4acefaeb3a6">[email protected]</a>. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/68f7ac44.050a0220.39dfc1.0861.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/68f7ac44.050a0220.39dfc1.0861.GAE%40google.com</a>. </pre>
